page.title: 13Events in Stevington
page.content: Many events take place annually. Occasionally Jumble Sales are held when villagers turn out unwanted clothes and items.These are then sold in order to raise money for the upkeep of various village organisations.A May evening brings the Morris Men who dance beside the village cross.During June,July and August fetes are held by the Village Hall,Parish and Baptist Churches.In October the harvest is celebrated with thanksgiving at both churches.A harvest supper is held and food contributions auctioned.In November Guy Fawkes is still remembered by a bonfire and firework display.Later on in the same month a Christmas Fayre takes place.In December villagers join in carol singing along the streets and on Christmas Eve the Parish Church is crowded for the midnight service.
